revisionDesc.change: Replace internal notes with external notes
Silent Proofreading Corrections and Miller date note
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
revised header to move WWA staff names to respStmt; removed empty opener child elements; replaced wwa editorial notes with ptrs to external notes file.
Moved RMBucke to HandNote; fixed editor, date, and title; reviewed paragraphing
Replaced smart quotes with straight; removed external URL links.

Replaced straight quotes with smart quotes, added anotation on losses to George Whitman's regiment, corrected McReady annotation, separated Mattie Whitman and Jeff Whitman annotation according to context.
corrected spacing, corrected date in title
Encode regularization of contractions, days of week, and frequently misspelled words
Proofread and annotate GWW, TJW and Mattie, Harts Island, and Mason

body.p:
i received your letter last saturday Saturday i began to think you had forgotten to fulfill your promise promise to write every friday Friday to let two fridays Fridays pass i got it saturday Saturday with the three dolrs dollars well george is here dident didn't get paid till yesterday monday Monday Augus August 7 the men was paid last saturday Saturday down to harts island Harts Island george has been down there A couple of days to settle up he has had much writing to doo do fred Mcready was here last sunday Sunday week and helped him was here to tea the ball is not taken from his leg but he is going to have it taken out he looks very well I gess guess they are all sorry i dont don't know as they are sorry the war is over but i gess guess they would much rather staid stayed in camp i hope George will get in something he is very restless i tell him to not be worried i dont don't think it is because he is uneasy about gitting A living but such a change he is much stouter than when he was home before i wish he could get something to doo do at washington Washington i dont don't think he will work journey work he says he could not at present Jeff wants him to get a shop lease or buy a lot and go in business for himself i think he will doo do something
of the kind there is one or two wants to go in with him) but i think it is such an exciting life to live if any bad luck should befall him) i tell him to not be in a hurry but rest but i can see he is very uneasy he got a very honerable honorable discharge the turnout to honor the regment regiment i gess guess was very good Jeff and matty and hattie went over to see it they went over some store of Jeffs friends and had a good view george went over early in in the morning and it came nearly 3 oclock o'clock and no george come i couldent couldn't think what was the matter pretty soon he come on the horse he was to ride he had no time to eat any dinner he wore his new sword and sash looked very good) i dont don't know when i shall go to Burlington the weathe weather has been so hot and i have felt so weak but i shall go i think quite soon george has gone to new york New York to see about getting some clothing the military must be all doffed i think he ought to be rejoised rejoiced to think he went through the war without the loss of a limb there is so many unfortunates poor fellows) Jeff and mat and the children had a very pressing invitation to come to masons fathers he is home on a 30 days furlough but Jeffy cant can't leave mr Lane is away in the country write walt what you think about georges going into the building line jeff is going to put up a small house i think he is to have money of Dr. Ruggles write just what you think would be best for George Walt write it just to me and not for the family i expect han thinks we are never coming I have had so much to doo do i could not get any ready)
